lines.gurmukhi: mn mDukir giq BRmq cqur kuMt crn kml suK sMpt smweIAY
lines.transliteration_english: Man Madhoukari Gati Bhramat Chatur Kounta , Charan Kamal Soukh Sanpat Samaaeeai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: The mind wanders like a bumble bee in all four directions. But by coming into the refuge of True Guru and by the blessings of Naam Simran, he merges into peace and comfort of equipoise.

lines.gurmukhi: sIql sugMD Aiq koml AnUp rUp mDu mkrMd qs Anq n DweIAY
lines.transliteration_english: Seetal Sougandh Ati Komal Anoop Roopa , Madhu Makarand Tas Anat N Dhaaeeai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: Once the calming, scented, delicate and very beautiful elixir-like holy dust of the feet of True Guru is received, the mind does not wander in any direction.

lines.gurmukhi: shj smwiD aunmn jgmg joiq Anhd Duin runJun ilv lweIAY
lines.transliteration_english: Sahaj Samaadhi Ounaman Jagamag Joti , Anahad Dhouni Rounajhoun Liv Laaeeai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: On account of his association with the holy feet of the True Guru, by remaining in a state of divine will and tranquil state of meditation and ever enjoying a glimpse of the light effulgent, he remains engrossed in the melodious unstruck celestial music.

lines.gurmukhi: gurmuiK bIs iekIs sohM soeI jwnY Awpw AprMpr prmpdu pweIAY ]222]
lines.transliteration_english: Gurmukhi Bees Ikees Sohan Soee Jaanai , Aapaa Aparanpar Paramapadu Paaeeai ?222?

Shabad OS B.translation: Believe it! An obedient Sikh of the True Guru becomes aware of the One Lord who is beyond all limits. And thus he reaches the supreme spiritual state. (222)
